cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 330 mi SE of the Mouth of the Rio Grande
cyclone.trajectory: expected to drift north-northeast through Saturday, then turn north and finally west toward the mid-Texas coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: mid-Texas coast near Matagorda Bay/Port O’Connor area

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western Gulf coast from northern Mexico to the Texas coastline, especially the mid-Texas coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible (34-kt probability up to 32%) with a low (7%) chance of 50-kt winds; hurricane-force winds appear unlikely at this time.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Slow-moving system and onshore flow could push water levels 2–4 ft or higher above ground in Matagorda and Lavaca Bays, including Calhoun Port’s approaches.
weather_observation.rainfall: Prolonged, very heavy rain bands could deposit 4–8 inches with localized higher amounts, causing freshwater flooding and operational delays.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, possible channel siltation/ shoaling, and reduced visibility in squalls.
